page.title: 01GREAT WENHAM AND RAYDON
page.content: The area of this block is mainly agricultural land with two small villages of Raydon and Great Wenham in the centre of each half of the block. Both these villages have a church and a public house but no school.The residential housing tends to be clustered mainly around the church with a few outlying farms. The area is undulating and used for growing crops such as oil seed rape, barley and wheat. Raydon comes from Reindun circa 1200 meaning Rye Hill.It has a population of 430 raising a product of a penny rate of 500 pounds. Great Wenham was mentioned in the Domesday Book and comes from the old high german {winn} meaning pasture and {hamm} a hamlet.It has a population of 140 raising a penny rate of 178 pounds
